Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2012 06:36AM autism_mom wrote: 44 i know its hard but try not to get too far ahead of yourself. unfortunately there is no way too plan ahead at this stage of the game. all of your question would be dependent on which type of cancer you have and what stage. but its a big IF! you should not assume you have cancer. one step at a time...one day at a time. easier said than done but you have good reason to stay positive. that whole 80% thing :) i wish you the best.

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2012 11:43AM autism_mom wrote: It seems to me that if a mammo is going to be a problem then he should order an mri. I mean what...youre never suppose to get a mammo? How do they plan on doing screening when the time comes (dont know how old you are). INSIST and cry a little if you think that might help:) As far as the ultrasound...I am a tech (cardiac and vascular) and I can tell you an ultrasound is only as good as the person doing it. So this is not to denigrate your cousin but if she doesnt do breast regularly its possible she missed something. I looked at my ultrasound and couldnt tell jack squat from adam...even knowing some of the things to look for. Give me a heart or a kidney no problem. Give me a breast and Im as lost as my 7 year old.

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2012 09:01PM autism_mom wrote: Ridergirl, DEXA scan is a bone density test.  I can't really explain the specifics cause I don't really get it, but it somehow measures the density in the lumbar spine, and the two femoral heads (I think) and then spits out a score. Now this is the part where I really get lost because there are positive and negative numbers but basically less than 1.5 is normal, 1.5 to 2.5 is osteopenia and you just have "thinned" bones, and greater than 2.5 is osteoporosis where you have "porous" bones.  So I guess osteoporosis is bones like swiss cheese, and osteopenia your bones are melting.  Not literally, but thats how I explained it to my dh...lol.  So I've got melting bones but according to my fav. IM doctor it would be "very unsual" for a spontaneous fracture to occur with just osteopenia.  Here's to hoping I'm very unsual!

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2012 06:58PM autism_mom wrote: semi final update (final final update when my breast is back to normal..lol) went and saw my boyfriend today (ie..internal med dr) and the results of the bone scan are no lytic or blastic lesions. he actually thought he saw a lytic lesion on my original xray and said spontaneous fractures are always highly suspicious for malignancy. but...no malignancy for me :) so for now we will assume it was the osteopenia that caused it, unusual as it may be. as for blood work i have a "significant" vitamin d deficiency which i find somewhat ironic since so many here have talked about that. i asked how low and he said im not "just low" im deficient. guess that explains the osteopenia at 40. so next stop is dermatologist (antibiotics did nothing) and gyn to try and figure out some sort of estrogen replacement that wont cause endometriosis to act up...oh and for very long overdue pap. once again thank you all so much for the support. i will be hanging around watching out for those i feel like i have come to know and trying to offer support when and where i can. take care all...kristin

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2012 04:07PM autism_mom wrote: Well, I finally got a call back.  Mammo and ultrasound were negative.  So I ask the ma what about the rib fracture, where were they.  She said 4th and 5th rib posterior (okay, now I am counting 2 rib fractures) and that it will just take time to heal.  I said, well ribs don't just fracture themselves so what are you going to do about this.  She puts me on hold...again.  Comes back, hold on the doctor needs to go through your chart.  At this point I'm thinking, wow, he's telling me to wait them out knowing that I just had a diagnostic mammo and ultrasound and he hasn't even seen my chart.  So she comes back and says he wants to see me in the morning and make sure I'm fasting so he can do blood work.  Okay, now I already know I will be finding a new doctor but figure I can get some blood work running while I'm on vacation.  She transfers me to scheduling and they say, can you come in at 11:00.  Uhm, no.  I don't think I'm going to fast that long.  Oh, okay then how about 8:00.  These people are completely incompetent!!!!!  So what kind of blood work should I be insisting on?  Any ideas out there?

Posts.Content: autism_mom wrote: 3 weeks ago I started having pain in my breast bone and shoulder blade.  No problem...costalchondritis I figured.  About a week into it my breast started to hurt.  And I mean HURT!  Burning at first, deep inside.  Then feeling engorged like I really need to breast feed.  Then really sore like I just had one heck of a vigorous breast feeding session.  Then the nipple started to be red and painful.  No discharge.  Slight rash on underside of breast but really looks more like dermatitis than anything.  Started to do self exams and found small (bb or pea size) lump in armpit, and multiple "lumps" in chest area above breast.  Don't know if these are lymph nodes or what.  Also getting tons of veins all of a sudden on my breasts, but it is both breasts. Anyways, I went to the dr. and got an order for dx mammo and ultrasound, plus a rib xray.  I had those done on Tuesday and got results for xray back today but not mammo and ultrasound.  Said I have a corticle rib fracture.  Okay...I had absolutely no trauma.  Did nothing to injure myself.  Didn't have any bouts of coughing or vomiting. So now I'm just a bit freaked out.  Does this sound like BC with mets to my ribs???? And here's the problem.  I am GOING to go to a breast specialist regardless of the mammo and ultrasound results, but have a vacation planned with my 3 kids and hubby next week.  How long can I wait to have a dx and start treatment?  I doubt a week will make much difference, but just thought I should check with some people who have been there...done that. Thanks Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Got a problem...how long can I wait? autism_mom Paintingmywaythru

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2012 11:21AM autism_mom wrote: I now have rib pain on my side.  And unless you can break/injure a rib vacuuming, I definately didn't do anything to hurt myself.  So question...if this was a bone mets thing, how fast does this stuff spread?  My other possibility is osteoporosis (i'm only 40 but probably high risk...2x lupron depo for endometriosis, long term mag sulfate last 2 pregnancies, historectomy 7 years ago and no hrt in about 4 years) but from what I have researched, osteoporosis doesn't have breast pain, nipple irritation as a symptom. Anybody know about rapidness of bone mets?
Posts.Title: Got a problem...how long can I wait? autism_mom Paintingmywaythru

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2012 05:22PM autism_mom wrote: Okey dokey. So I am feeling much better about things now. Everyone who has been talking up MD Anderson is spot on. And I didnt even go to the Houston facility. Finally had my appt. today. I loved the dr. I saw. She ws not too happy with how my right breast looks. It is not swollen but there is a bright pink rash on th top and outside of it that actually showed up yesterday. There is also bruising (not self inflicted from poking and pushing. I showed them the two self inflicted bruiss in the axillary area..lol). She said she doesnt really think Ibc because there is no thickening but brought up ibc several times without prompting. I decided my strategy was going to go in and let them look and give an opinion before I brought up any of my theories. So she did a skin punch biopsy (which my kids think is super cool and my dd is hoping to get the sample back so she can keep it in a jar) and said if it doesnt show anything she would provably do an mri if my symptoms are persisting by next appt. She also sent me straight to the imaging center for a repeat mammo and ultrsound which of course still dont show anything. She also has me set up with one of their internal med drs tomorrow after my dexa scan to address the spontaneous rib fractures. So all in all a pretty productive visit. I feel like I am finally in competent hands and they will keep working to uncover the problem. She did talk about trying antibiotics if all else fails but doesnt believe that it is an infection. The only bad thing is that the strange breast texture (dimply..wrinkly..I dont even know how to describe it) was on hiatus for the appt. I may have to try getting some pics to show her. Thank you all for the wonderful support so far. I promise to keep you posted.
Posts.Title: Got a problem...how long can I wait? autism_mom Paintingmywaythru

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2012 08:23PM autism_mom wrote: Update for today. I am in love with MD Anderson. I seriously feel like I should make a commercial for these people.  But first things first.  I went for my DEXA scan (who knew what a simple little test that would be) and managed to weezle the report out of the tech.  Turns out that I have osteopenia at the ripe old age of 40.  Oh well, I knew I had a lot of risk factors.  Then had an appt. with my new favorite internal medicine guy.  He walks into the room about 45 seconds after I sit down (always a plus) and we start talking.  This guy already knew my whole history...including things I hadn't ever even mentioned to the.  He actually studied my case before I got there and without even looking at any notes was discussing the entire new history and a bunch of old stuff that he thought my be relevant to my current problem.  I was completely in awe.  So bottom line...he took my cd from my rib xray (which also had my previous mammo and ultrasound on it) and said he was going to go over it with the radiologist to see what they could figure out.  Meanwhile he ordered additional blood work and a bone scan to see if my ribs are the result of metastasis.  I dont know how accurate those are but he said it would show if they were due to cancer.  Hes going to talk with the bs and radiologist and said he will call me within 24 hours to let me know what our plan is.  I went and got my blood work done, and went home.  As I'm walking in the door, my phone is ringing.  My bs is calling to tell me the results of the skin punch biopsy are in.  I said, well that was fast and she told me that the pathologist called her to discuss the case when he got the sample.  It's so weird.  These people have really got their s*** together!!!  Anyways, the result is that it doesn't show "cancer" but it does show inflammation so she is going to get a breast MRI.  I didn't have to ask or beg for any of this stuff...all the stuff I wanted done.  So I still don't know anything really, but man alive am I impressed with my "team".

Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2012 07:49PM autism_mom wrote: kishana how long have you had your symptoms? Also did you see your pcp...gyn...breast specialist? I took the advice of everyone on here and got an appt with a breast specialist/surgeon. I just happen to be lucky enough to live close to an md anderson cancer center wich according to all on the ibc forum and others is the top for ibc dx tx and research. But also mayo clinic and i think fox chase (i had never heard of that one). You should go to the ibc forum and post question for best centers. I dont think that forum is as active so might take a bit to get a response. If ibc is what it is a month is too long to wait. I didnt need a referral either. They had a special clinic for undiagnosed people. Probably the other centers have that kind of thing too. Just wanted me to bring whatever films I had. And just to note...most of the posts are from people like us who have ibc symptoms but who didnt end up having it. I think Ive only seen maybe one who ended up having that dx. Also...it can happen but it is exceedingly rare for ibc to be bilateral. Dont know if that helps with you worry...it certainly hasnt for me . . lol

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2012 07:49AM autism_mom wrote: kishana, I am still trying to figure out all of this metastasis stuff myself, but my understanding is that it usually metastasizes (sp?) to other parts of the body first through the lymphatic system first but I dont know.  I think there are a few women on the ibc forum who have gotten it in both breasts simultaneously.  And also a few that had ibc in one breast and another type like idc or dcis in the other breast.  I with you though...it doesn't help the worry.  And alot of women say that because of the aggresive nature of ibc that in 7 months it would be "obviously" ibc by now, but there are also quite a few that were misdiagnosed for that long.  So basically...I know nothing!  lol  Do you have the thickening, or peau d'orange or nipple inversion (sorry, I can't remember exactly from your original post)?  It is REALLY irritating that the mammo and ultrasound seems to be the end all be all for so many doctors when it comes to ruling out bc.  There are so so many here who had a negative mammo and ultrasound who did indeed have bc.  It just takes a doctor who is not willing to say, 'well your tests were negative so you are fine'.  If you are having signs (and really, visual changes are SIGNS not symptoms) then they should be pursued.  People's breasts don't just change colors for no damn reason!!!!!  Okay, enough of the rant.  I really feel for you, completely understand your fear and frustration.  I don't know about the system in Canada.  Do you have to do everything through your gp, or can you go see someone on your own, like a breast specialist? ps...sorry, I know this entire post probably makes no sense.  I'm still on my first cup of coffee :)

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2012 06:01PM autism_mom wrote: Hello all, I am back from my family vacation (which was great) and I have a few updates and questions that I hope somebody can answer. First, before I left i saw my PCP who ordered a DEXA scan, did some basic blood work including a SED rate (forgot to ask for the thyroid dang it!) and referred me to a breast surgeon.  Well, I made the appts. but the bs couldn't see me until Aug 3rd which I thought was a little far off (she is out of town).  But MD Anderson called me back and I have an appt with the Suspicion of BC clinic?? on Monday the 23rd.  DEXA scan is the 24th and haven't heard back about my blood work yet.  While I was gone, my right breast started to get what I am guessing to be the peau d'orange look to it.  There are still alot of broken capillaries all over but no bright red rashy looking areas.  The shape is also very distorted if I look down, but not as much if I look in the mirror.  The nipple actually looks to be pointing towards my right arm.  The pain is much better unless I wear a bra, bathing suit or even a tank top with the little built in shelf thing.  So I have been going "commando" for a month now.  So this breast DEFINATELY does not look right but I don't know if it will be noticable to anyone but me.  Problem is...now the other breast is acting up.  The first thing I noticed was the broken capillary redness.  Then while I was in the shower I noticed a big swelling under the left arm and some "lumps" in the area right above the breast, close to the armpit.  Then within a day or two there were multiple bruises on the breast and lymph nodes areas but the bruises were light a pinkish, orangy-yellowish color.  And I have what I can only call a "disappearing areola".  The areola is literally blending into the color of the skin (where the broken capillaries are).  Okay...also, when I got my mammo films back and took a look at them, the right breast is CLEARLY much larger than the left.  This was not the case on my last mammo.  Plus, I'm no radiologist, but I swear there is skin thickening, especially in the area of the areolas. So questions: Does anyone have experience with MD Anderson Suspicion on BC clinic and what do you think? Does anyone have experience with having symptoms in both breasts (I am thinking IBC or ILC here...) Has anyone had this mysterious disappearing areola phenomenon and had it mean something? Will the DEXA scan show if there is a malilgnancy or does it just show bone thickness (have tried to research but still can't tell)  And btw, these rib fractures do not feel like they are healing.  Keep having flare ups of pain, etc. I am going out of my mind.  I feel like an idiot...like I am somehow conjuring all of these weird breast changes and the doctors are going to just laugh at me.  In a way, I am almost glad for the rib fractures because maybe it will be what makes them take me seriously.  Sorry for the long post.  I hope somebody will have some answers.  Thank you.
Posts.Title: Got a problem...how long can I wait? autism_mom Paintingmywaythru

Posts.Content: autism_mom wrote: 3 weeks ago I started having pain in my breast bone and shoulder blade.  No problem...costalchondritis I figured.  About a week into it my breast started to hurt.  And I mean HURT!  Burning at first, deep inside.  Then feeling engorged like I really need to breast feed.  Then really sore like I just had one heck of a vigorous breast feeding session.  Then the nipple started to be red and painful.  No discharge.  Slight rash on underside of breast but really looks more like dermatitis than anything.  Started to do self exams and found small (bb or pea size) lump in armpit, and multiple "lumps" in chest area above breast.  Don't know if these are lymph nodes or what.  Also getting tons of veins all of a sudden on my breasts, but it is both breasts. Anyways, I went to the dr. and got an order for dx mammo and ultrasound, plus a rib xray.  I had those done on Tuesday and got results for xray back today but not mammo and ultrasound.  Said I have a corticle rib fracture.  Okay...I had absolutely no trauma.  Did nothing to injure myself.  Didn't have any bouts of coughing or vomiting. So now I'm just a bit freaked out.  Does this sound like BC with mets to my ribs???? And here's the problem.  I am GOING to go to a breast specialist regardless of the mammo and ultrasound results, but have a vacation planned with my 3 kids and hubby next week.  How long can I wait to have a dx and start treatment?  I doubt a week will make much difference, but just thought I should check with some people who have been there...done that. Thanks Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Got a problem...how long can I wait? autism_mom Paintingmywaythru

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2012 07:06AM autism_mom wrote: from what i have read pathological fractures are to be considered "malignant" until proven otherwise. i think based on the appearance of my breast my bs is still ruling out bc. skin punch biopsies can be false negatives. also osteopenia is not likely to produce fractures (not like osteoporosis) but it is a small possibility. my drs are just being extra cautious.

Posts.Title: Share a Funny... Lowrider54 barsco1963

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2012 09:25PM autism_mom wrote: heres how it works with alot of US repoting systems the tech writes a report listing all their finds but does not write a conclusion (or opinion). they stick the report in a reading box (or in a queue if paperless). the dr comes along and looks at the US. if he disagrees with the tech he makes changes then adds his conclision (opinion). if he agrees with the tech he doesnt change anything but adds a conclusion. the conclusion usually lists all the pertinent findings again then and opinion as to what the patient should do next. once he does that he electronically signs it and THAT is the final report. in your cade it seems like a step got missed. your dr either erroneously received the preliminary report instead of the final or there was a software glitch that didnt update the report with the conclusion and nobody noticed. last possibility is that it was a screening clinic in which case no dr looked at it but it doesnt sound like thats the case. so dont worry about what it means or doesnt mean. it was likely an error and you are going to the bs which is for the best anyways.

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2012 12:51AM autism_mom wrote: amydee is your breast enlarged? have you had a fever? and are your lymph nodes enlarged? im sorry...i cant be much help but i can tell you that the majority of women who come to bco with concerns of ibc and find out that their symptoms are due to something else so dont panic. with that said im sure you already know how aggressive ibc is so its good that your pcp is being proactive. i would suggest researching a good breast surgeon in your area who is familiar with ibc so that you hve somebody lined up if you decide to go that direction after your mammo and ultrasound. and remember that those tests dont typically pick up ibc so if they are negative but you still have symptoms get to a bs soon. good luck. im sure someone with more knowledge will be along soon to post better answers.

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2012 07:49PM autism_mom wrote: it seems like the most common symptom in ibc is the skin thickening. someone described it as being like when the skin on your heels get thick. the other biggy seems to be nipple inversion. you do not have to have all or most of the symptoms. many said they had only one. so if you are going to take the wait and see approach at least keep an eye out for either of those two. personally if i ws having that pain i would keep pursuing but i understand about being busy and not sure if you want to make something out of nothing. good luck with your decision and keep us posted.

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2012 09:16PM autism_mom wrote: Had ooph in 2007 laprascopic.  At the time I had a 2, 4, and 6 year old.  I took off one week of work, but probably could have done with two (but had a sort of physical job at the time).  My best advice after any surgery (and I have had 3 c sections, hysto, ooph, gallbladder, and lap/laser) is to take the pain medicine on time as prescribed instead of waiting for the pain to get bad and to get up and move as ofter as possible.  Nothing heavy, just a walk around the hallway to start out.  The more often and sooner I moved after surgery, the faster I recovered (wish I had known that for the first c section).  The shoulder pain can get bad but if it does, try laying on the painful side for some temporary relief.  Good luck to you.

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2012 11:01AM autism_mom wrote: alex you have made a very food decision to fo to a gyn. im so sorry you have been worrying about this for so long. it is most likely NOT bc but you will not feel assured of that until you hear it from a professional. we all have weird lumps and bumps on our bodies and its completely understndable to jump to the cancer conclusion. so dont feel bad or mad at yourself for not speaking up when you were 10. 10 year olds...or even 15 yer olds dont have the developmental maturity to make decisions where consequences are involved. the lumps in your head are probably fibromas (little fatty tumors) that are completely benign but have your doctor check them out too. please dont delete your post. another young person may come along with the same concerns and this thread could help them. bco is all about getting educated and finding others like yourself so you dont feel so alone. please keep us posted on what you find out.

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2012 11:57AM autism_mom wrote: The urinary problem sounds like it could possibly be interstitial cystitis and your gyn should be able to deal with that. When you have a constellation of symptoms they can all be related. Anything from hormonal abnormalities to endometriosis (I had urinary problems for years with my endo) to cancer. Now that you will have insurance I urge you to make sure your gyn follows up on ALL your symptoms. If he/she gives you the impression of being 'blown off' find a different gyn. It doesnt matter how you dealt with this in the past...only how you deal with it in the present and future. Good luck and please let us know how it goes on Friday.
